data.title: Man: Greatest Feats Compilation
data.meta_description: Hey guys!I've decided to create a repository of Spider-Man's greatest feats with their sources included, since many other respect threads have broken
data.text:
Hey guys!

I've decided to create a repository of Spider-Man's greatest feats with their sources included, since many other respect threads have broken links or don't include sources. Spider-Man is one of the best comic book characters ever, so it is time he got a respect thread worthy of him. There are going to be no limits on what can and can't be included here, so please feel free to PM me or post scans below for me to add (but please, try and provide sources for all scans)! If you can provide sources for the minority of uncited feats, that would be greatly appreciated as well. I will add your name to the credits list if you do contribute to improving this thread in any way. :)

Anyways, I really hope you enjoy the thread!

How to navigate:

The headings below all contain hyper-links to their respective sections. You can click any of the main headings (the whole number ones - ex. strength or durability) to be transported directly to that section, or you can just scroll down the thread at your leisure. I have also tried to order feats in each sub-category by impressiveness, though that was obviously subjective, so your mileage may vary. If you really think something needs to be re-ordered, feel free to shoot me a PM or post down below.

Thanks for reading!

Notes:

If a feat has an asterisk in brackets following its description, as shown here: (*), then it is from a story which is either retroactively set in Spider-Man's past (such as Untold Tales of Spider-Man, or Spider-Man: Learning to Crawl) or are short-term alternate future possibilities, which means it may be debatable regarding whether it is canon or not. I haven't included feats from stories which are set in Spider-Man's past, but certainly don't occur in 616 (ex. Spidey).

Table of Contents

1. Strength

1.1. Striking

1.2. Lifting

1.3. Other

2. Durability

2.1. Blunt Force and Piercing Attacks

2.2. Energy and Sonic Attacks

2.3. Chemical and Biological Attacks

2.4. Attacks that fit in multiple categories

2.5. Healing

2.6. Stamina and Endurance

3. Speed and Agility

3.1. Movement Speed

3.2. Combat Speed and Reactions

3.3. Agility and Equilibrium

4. Spider-Sense

5. Wall-Crawling

6. Webbing

6.1. Regular Formula Strength/Durability

6.1.1. Upgraded Parker Industries-era formula

6.2. Webbing Manipulation

6.3. Different Formulas/Types

6.4. Webbing Appreciation

7. Intelligence

7.1. General Intelligence

7.2. Quick-thinking and calculation speed/pattern recognition

7.3. Biology and Chemistry

7.4. Physics and Math

7.5. Engineering

7.5.1. Suits

7.6. Computers

8. Skills

8.1. Fighting Skills

8.2. Detective Skills

8.3. Accuracy

8.4. Stealth

9. Willpower

10. Technology/Gadgets

10.1. Spider-Armor Mark IV

10.1.1. General Capabilities

10.1.2. Sensors and Heads-Up Display

10.1.3. Enhanced Durability

10.1.4. Augmented Strength

10.1.5. Upgraded Web-Shooters

10.2. Webware

10.3. Spider-Man 2099 Armor

10.3.1. General Capabilities

10.3.2. Enhanced Durability

10.4. Spider-Armor Mark III

10.5. Omniharmonic Mesh Stealth Suit

10.5.1. General Capabilities

10.5.2. Stealth and Sonic Capabilities

10.5.3. Enhanced Durability

10.6. Iron Spider Armor

10.6.1. General Capabilities

10.6.2. Enhanced Durability

10.6.3. Waldoes

10.7. Spider-Tracers

10.7.1. General Capabilities

10.7.2. Different Types

10.8 General/Standard Gear

11. Notable Battles, Character Statements, Best Quips/Quotes and Epic Moments

11.1. Battles

11.2. Character Statements

11.3. Best Quips

11.4. Spider-Man Quotes

11.5. Epic Moments

12. Credits

13. Coming Soon Feats

Coming Soon Feats

This section is for feats I have tracked down but haven't gotten around to posting on my imgur or adding them in categories on this thread yet. Unlike the rest of the thread, I haven't tried to order these feats in terms of impressiveness.

ETA to add this batch of feats: a week or two

Healing: recovers from thousands of bee stings extremely quickly (spectacular 37)

His optic nerve regenerates so quickly that he recovers from what should be permanent blindness in just a few days (SSM 27/28)

Spider Sense: When Peter is blinded it can work just like radar sense (SSM 28)

Strength: easily rips off a chimney (spectacular 46)

Easily rips through triple-reinforced steel (SSM 56)

Oneshots Jack O Lantern (SSM 56)

Holds up a small crane (SSM 61)

Lifts a van which weighs more than a bull elephant (SSM 65)

Rips apart Doc Ock’s arms (SSM 75)

Easily rips off a train car (SSM 106)

Pulverizes a stone chimney (uncited)

One-shots the Man Ape (Black Panther v4 18)

Intelligence: pre-programs Mysterio’s holographic illusion system which only a scientific wizard could do (SSM 51)

Creates a solution which can melt gold but not harm human flesh in seconds (SSM 62)

Figures out the structure of a synthetic vibranium before either Iron man or Black Panther (Web of Spider-Man Annual 7)

Stamina: survives enough drugs to kill a whole herd of elephants (ASM 199)

Fights: defeats a whole private army (SSM 52)

Speed: easily leaps over 20 feet (SSM 59)

Leaps over 30 feet (SSM 66)

Dodges a ton of sniper bullets (uncited)

Dazzles a whole room of enemies with sheer speed (uncited)

Fighting skills: beats the beetle who had programmed his armor to counter all of Spider-Man’s moves (SSM 60)

Webs: hold a two ton elevator (SSM 79)

Intelligence: Peter modifies Dr. Octopus' Spider-bots to create self-replicating nanite technology that can suppress Goblin Serum potent enough to kill thousands, and can recreate themselves faster than they can be destroyed. (Superior Spider-Man 31/Amazing Spider-Man v4 32)

Expert research scientists are unable to determine the composition of Spidey's webbing even after months of work (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 26)

Reed Richards says Peter is proficient at robotics (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 55)

Strength: Spider-Man crushes the Green Goblin's hands with ease (Superior Spider-Man 31)

Strong enough to use his webs to manipulate the direction Mjolnir is flying in (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 2)

Hurts the Hulk (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 14)

Hurts the god Tokkots (Peter Parker: Spider-Man)

Easily rips off a Doombot's head (Amazing Spider-Man v2 15)

Speed and Agility: Dodges Bullseye's attacks (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 6)

Statements: Hulk says Spider-Man is strong (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 14)

Osborn says Peter has bested him physically and is smarter and more resolute than he himself is (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 25)

Webbing: Hurts the Hulk (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 14)

Supports the weight of a train (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 14)

Stamina/Endurance: Keeps punching the Hulk until his hands are damaged and bleeding (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 14)

Isn't thirsty after not drinking water in 2 days (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 25)

Skills (Stealth): Sneaks into Latveria unnoticed (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 15)

Willpower: Manages to fight off a whole week's worth of drugging and mind control from the Green Goblin (ASM v2 26)

Durability: Unaffected by enough electricity to make Doc Ock scream and lose control of his arms (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 41)

Quotes: to Doc Ock (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 41)

Spider Sense: Can tell if someone is in his apartment (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 50)

Spider Sense can detect motion detectors and security cameras (Peter Parker: Spider-Man 156.1)

@jb681131 said:

@blackspidey2099: Damn man what a good thread ! You should ask to be pinpointed and you should post the content on other sites as well ! I haven't read it all yet, but did you mention the fact that in "Kraven's Last Hunt" he managed to get out by himself out of his own grave. He was burried alive.

Thank you! I'm not sure what being "pinpointed" is, but I may post this on other sites too if I get time. The problem is that I'm not sure if the ComicVine formatting will work on other sites, so I'd have to relink everything and that would be boring and tedious, lol.

As for Kraven's Last Hunt, while that was a good story, none of those were impressive feats for Peter (getting KOed for days by a poison, getting shown up by Kraven who is significantly weaker and less powerful, etc.). Even digging out of a grave isn't too impressive for Peter - physically. I might be able to put it in the willpower section, though. However, it's been a while since I read it, so I will go through it again to see if I can find anything. Or, if you are reading it, please feel free to post a specific instance out of that story (or any others) which showed Peter doing something impressive or out of his usual capabilities.

I've just currently finished reading Peter Parker: Spider-Man, so I'm working on making scans of the best feats I found in that series (look at the post above yours), uploading them to imgur, and then posting them here. When I'm done with that, I'll move on to other issues.

Thanks again!
